column5: I think this is a horrible, blasphemous idea.  Just disgusting, really.  Is there no bottom to corporate (and Bettman's) greed?  http://www.cbc.ca/sports/hockey/nhl/nhl-sersey-ads-coming-says-league-exec-1.2826466
Hec, I thought advertising on the boards was disgusting,  but then again I grew up with Murray Westgate and " Happy Motoring " as the big sponsor of Leafs games
I can only think of one team that skates slow enough to read them...

Taking a cue from the euro leagues, sad to see I just hope it's not gaudy and detracts from the actual jersey. and I really hope they keep any and all winter classic jerseys free of them, being a vintage look there should be none
I can only think of one team that skates slow enough to read them...

Ads on the broads, on the ice, the screen behind the interviewee, behind the coach on the bench, in the penalty box, in the arena hallway, on the steps in the arena, ridiculously bigger logos on the equipment, projected onto the glass behind the nets, rotating light boards, as I'm standing at the urinal, every tv segment sponsored by a faceless conglomerate.  Hate it all, but the only thing I have to say is:  Surprised it took this long.

NBA already inked a deal as well. The only issue was how to split up the ad revenue or it would be on the jerseys this year. Nascar, Fishing, Soccer... It will come to the NFL and MLB eventually as well.
you think the Yankee's would ever put advertising on their shirts?
Yes. The only question is the price.
I can only think of one team that skates slow enough to read them...
I can only think of one team that skates slow enough to read them...  And the coincidence is that they have the only fans that can read.
